page.title: 02 Otley 1086-1985
page.content: As is the case with many of our villages,Otley is first mentioned by name in the Domesday Book(1086). The name is thought to mean Â£the clearing or meadow of Ota',who would have been an early Anglo-Saxon settler.He was by no means the first person to settle here,however.Romano- British pottery found near the church indicates much earlier habitation,and there are almost certainly other similar or,perhaps,even older sites yet to be discovered.The Romans drove a road through what is now the southern end of the village,and archaeological evidence suggests that there were several Roman settlements in the area, although none has yet been found in Otley itself.
